plots module

plots.cm_analysis(y_true, y_pred, filename, labels, title='Placeholder for title', ymap=None, figsize=(10, 10))

Generate matrix plot of confusion matrix with pretty annotations. The plot image is saved to disk.

Parameters:

  • y_true (True label of the data, with shape (nsamples,).) –

  • y_pred (Prediction of the data, with shape (nsamples,).) –

  • filename (Filename of figure file to save.) –

  • labels (string array, name the order of class labels in the confusion matrix.) – use clf.classes_ if using scikit-learn models. with shape (nclass,).

  • ymap (dict: any -> string, length == nclass.) – if not None, map the labels & ys to more understandable strings. Caution: original y_true, y_pred and labels must align.

  • figsize (the size of the figure plotted.) –

plots.construct_network(model, sub_dG, classes, title='Network', module_file=None)
plots.construct_ontology(dG, root, title='Ontology', module_file=None)
